name: Enable Encryption at Rest using AWS KMS Customer Managed Key (CMK) for ECR Repositories
description: Ensure that all Amazon ECR repositories are encrypted at rest using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Keys (CMKs). This provides an additional layer of security for container images stored in ECR.

name: Enable Image Scanning on Push for ECR Repositories
description: Enable automatic image scanning for all ECR repositories when images are pushed. This helps identify vulnerabilities in container images before they are deployed.

name: Configure Tag Immutability for ECR Repositories
description: Enable tag immutability for all ECR repositories to prevent image tags from being overwritten. This ensures consistency and traceability of container images.

name: Implement Lifecycle Policies for ECR Repositories
description: Configure lifecycle policies for all ECR repositories to automatically manage the retention and expiration of container images. This helps maintain storage efficiency and reduces the risk of using outdated images.

name: Ensure ECR Repositories are Private
description: Verify that all ECR repositories are set as private to prevent unauthorized access to container images. Public repositories should not be used unless explicitly required and approved.

name: Implement Least Privilege Access for ECR Repositories
description: Ensure that IAM policies for ECR repositories follow the principle of least privilege, granting only the necessary permissions to authorized entities for pushing, pulling, and managing container images.

name: Enable Encryption in Transit for ECR Repositories
description: Enforce the use of HTTPS (TLS) for all interactions with ECR repositories to ensure encryption of data in transit. This includes pushing, pulling, and managing container images.

name: Implement Cross-Region Replication for Critical ECR Repositories
description: Enable cross-region replication for critical ECR repositories to ensure data redundancy and availability of container images across multiple AWS regions.

name: Monitor and Remediate Vulnerabilities in ECR Images
description: Regularly review the results of ECR image scans and implement a process to remediate identified vulnerabilities in a timely manner. This may include updating base images, applying patches, or rebuilding images with security fixes.

name: Implement ECR Repository Policies
description: Configure ECR repository policies to control access at the repository level, complementing IAM policies. This allows for fine-grained access control and the ability to share repositories across AWS accounts securely.

name: Enable AWS CloudTrail for ECR API Activity Monitoring
description: Ensure that AWS CloudTrail is configured to capture all ECR API activities. This provides an audit trail for monitoring and investigating actions taken on ECR repositories and images.

name: Implement ECR Image Tagging Strategy
description: Establish and enforce a consistent image tagging strategy for all ECR repositories. This should include version information, build identifiers, and other relevant metadata to ensure proper image identification and management.

name: Use FIPS Endpoints for ECR in Sensitive Workloads
description: For workloads that require FIPS 140-2 compliance, ensure that FIPS endpoints are used when interacting with ECR repositories. This provides additional cryptographic protection for sensitive container images.

name: Implement ECR Pull Through Cache Repositories Securely
description: If using ECR pull through cache repositories, ensure they are configured securely with appropriate access controls and encryption settings. This helps maintain the security of cached public images within your private ECR environment.

name: Enable ECR Scan Findings Export to Security Hub
description: Configure ECR to export image scan findings to AWS Security Hub for centralized vulnerability management and compliance reporting across your AWS environment.
